intro: Ceraria kaokoensis, commonly known as the Kaoko ceraria, is a flowering plant native to the hyperarid regions of Namibia and Angola. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in its harsh environment.
